Material used.Description: The parkin Ubld and ubiquitin were expressed and purified from E. coli.

Readout description.Result Description: The R42P mutation causes the complete unfolding of the parkin Ubld.
The K48A mutation had little effect on the stability of the parkin Ubld or ubiquitin.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiments were conducted on multiple batches of recombinant proteins.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was measured multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type parkin Ubld was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Unfolded parkin Ubld was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Nonlinear global analysis of multiple data sets.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Ellipticity at 222 nm with a defined minimum.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Loss of defined minimum at 222 nm and appearance of a broad featureless minimum near 230 nm.

Material used.Description: The GB1-UbldR42P fusion protein was expressed and purified from E. coli.

Readout description.Result Description: The 1H-15N HSQC spectrum of GB1-UbldR42P showed a mass of peaks located in the central region of the spectrum, indicating that the UbldR42P was unfolded.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiments were conducted on multiple batches of recombinant proteins.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was measured multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type GB1-Ubld was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Unfolded GB1-Ubld was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Comparison of peak positions and intensities in the 1H-15N HSQC spectra.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Well-dispersed peaks with line widths appropriate for proteins in the 8-15 kDa range.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Mass of peaks located in the central region of the spectrum.
